[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 44 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 161[Air Date: 7/29/1985] [3]--Connection

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Lesbian mother loses custody rights2. Minneapolis health club discriminates against gay man3. Hollywood city council mandates HTLVIII testingCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp4. Lesbian presidential candidate at University of Oregon wins election5. Before stonewallCOMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity: gay and lesbian disabled6. Pittsburgh woman complains about gay organization's public phone listings7. Mayor Koch addresses Greater Gotham Business Council, includes clip8. Court upholds John McBride's will, includes over 100,000 dollar donation to gay civil rights 9. Brooklyn Public Library censorship10. 1985 Gay Pride Parade, includes coverageCOMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper11. Sports12. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Martin P. Levine, assistant professor of Sociology at Bloomfield College, discusses masculinity and gay sexuality13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Media reports/current events/culture, includes clips. Joan Rivers, Dr. Robert Jackson, Health Commissioner of South CarolinaCOMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine2. Broadway, films, includes clip of "The Goonies"COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club3. Sybil Bruncheon tours parkCOMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity with Abigail Van Buren "Dear Abby"4. Sybil BruncheonCOMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos Resort, San Juan, Puerto Rico5. Channel 13 celebrates Gay Pride Week with three documentaries during primetime: Silent Pioneers, The Word is Out, In the Best Interest of the Children, includes clips
